text: 16floz can (~$8/four-pack), canned on 03.08.2017, poured into a pint glass. Copper in color, check. Piney and citrus aroma, check. Wait theres more, Bitter, but possesses enough of a malt to provide a caramel biscuit backdrop.This may be a red lager, but far from any traditional lager. Its good. although it could be better with more malt - a la American strong dark lager with a hoppy presence.

Can. Pours a clear amber with a near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a combination of grass and citrus with a grain backbone. Flavor has a good amount of sweet grains with grass and a hint of citrus backing.

Minnesota Beer Trip #216. Keg at the brewery, 5/13/16. Clear copper, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of citrus hops and caramel. The taste is citrus, mint, caramel. Medium bodied, crisp.
Dark copper color with a medium head. Aroma of a grain silo with a bit of caramel and bread. Moderate bitterness. Light grain flavor. Just a bit piney. Dry finish.

Half of a 16 oz. can, consumed on 5-26-16. Floral aroma features toasted malts. Citric, piney smell features scents of tonic water and lemon from the hops. Pours a clear, medium to dark copper with a very large amount of golden beige head. Probably too much head. Uneven head and thick lacing. I really like the flavor. Maillard reaction evident; caramelized. Nice and dry taste. Lightly citric flavor; grapefruit. Light to medium body. Not as crisp as a lager should be in the palate. Soft. Im quite impressed overall.
Tap at the Gnome. Clear golden pour with a monster foamy head. Pine hop with husky grains. Theres a sweetness to this as well. Not bad. Good hop bite late.

On tap at Red Cow, pours a copper orange with a large khaki head. Mild fruit and caramel malt with some yeast the aroma. Big bready caramel malt held up by fruity hops and hop bitterness finish dry and bitter with lager yeast. Nice! Drinkable.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is cleat Orange with a big white head and sticky lacing. Husky, candied oranges, grapefruit, doughy, grassy aroma. Taste is husky, herbal hoppy, grass, lemon drops, floral hope, dough, and bread with a slightly bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Meh.

Pour on tap at Red Wagon, slightly hazy reddish pour with slightly off white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, bread, and lots of yeast and spicy notes, hints of grass and a slight honey note with a touch of toast. Taste was a mix of toast, bread, slight toffee into a bit of grass, yeast and slight earth, finishing slightly bitter.

16oz on tap into to pint glass. Minneapolis. 
 
Pours copper-orange in color. Mostly transparent. Small white head with lacing. 

Aroma is mostly malty. Some hints or caramel. Subtle piney hop notes. 

Taste is dominatly sweet. bitterness is mostly in the finish. 

Medium body. Average carbonation. Relatively long finish. 

Decent beer. A little in the sweet side for my taste. Not especially aromatic.
